title: Zero-interest-penalty CD Token
description: There is currently no sufficiently secure and audible stable token in existence nor is there a standard for their issuance.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is comprehensive and the attached documents answered most of the questions i initially had, The proposal does not request a lot of fund, this shows the Proposer is willing to put on the effort to refine the proposal to an executable plan before requesting for more fund. I have not seen the short term impart to the Cardano ecosystem, however given that Cardano is a research based Blockchain and this is just the beginning of research into certificate of deposit tokens , This might led to a novelty idea in subsequent fund. I am neutral.
f6_assessments.q1: The terminology of the attached document shows that the proposer has experience in Cardano Blockchain , The pseudocode algorithm in the document can be improve , there is a potential launch date , Though the definition of success is vague but the fund requested is only for Transportation , so I completely agree that the fund will be use for that purpose.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal  lack  clear KPI's that will allow the community to access it's impact.

f6_assessments.q0: In US CD is negotiable and therefore traded. Creating a Cardano Native assessment with one-to-one correspondence with CD will provide a stable coin. A similar system should be used by USDT and other USD hedged coins. But CD-backed coins established with corresponding metadata is likely to bring in a new era of reliability for stable coin and improve trust.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not claim experience in financial sector or in software development. However, he has evolved a unique plan which may or may not takeoff but is worth trying.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has just requested a token amount most probable to get feedback on his proposal and engagement with the community. The initiative is unique and bold with the potential to change the way stable coins are handled in the blockchain industry. If CD-backed stable coins become a reality it can have a huge impact on the Blockchain ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The requested funds for this project are pretty low while the proposer will probably invest a lot of their personal time. This might however provide a nice new application, so these funds should be granted.
f6_assessments.q1: As a plutis pioneer the proposer should have the capability of programming this project. Realistic milestones exist and the budget basically is a compensation for travel costs. It is likelx this project will succeed and even if it wouldn't the costs would be very low.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones are comprehensive and auditable. The ojective is very clearly defined. Thus it should not be a problem to audit this.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal fits the challenge and will have some local impact on the community as explained in the proposal. There will be no need for transaction fees if using CDT, because these instruments will be regulated.
f6_assessments.q1:
Let's start with the obvious: for 50 dollars it's a no-brainer! Give the man his money to travel! What's written in the proposal is worth more.
A really detailed examination on what's needed to be done and a clear plan on introducing a somewhat stepping stone in order to have a digital projection of the dollar money. 
Which in turn opens the door for digitalization, building applications on top of this CDT and so forth, so it's a really useful start IMO.
A good idea, I hope you get it working. Good luck!
f6_assessments.q2:
If the proposer decides the implement his solution in the linked Github profile, there will be all the traceability anyone will need. 
Keeping in mind the small scale and asking price of the project, this shouldn't be too much of a concern.

solution: Credit unions and banks are regulated and insured by the NCUA and FDIC respectively and can issue certificates of deposit as on-chain coins.
